medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Mr. Estrada first experienced headache and lightheadedness for 5 days in 1966. Dizziness remains one of his chief symptoms, persisting for 33 years. His health has declined over time with episodes of weakness and dizziness.
medical_history.past_medical_history: He has a history of herpes zoster and was later diagnosed with pulmonary sarcoidosis characterized by widespread cystic disease and bilateral hilar adenopathy. Additionally, he developed papillary squamous-cell carcinoma of the glans penis, for which he underwent circumcision and subsequent distal penectomy.
medical_history.family_history: The family was not initially aware of Mr. Estrada's illnesses; they lived nearby but did not supervise his care.
medical_history.social_history: Mr. Estrada worked as a lay minister for a local Catholic church and lived independently. His son lived nearby, but there was a disconnect regarding his care needs. He retired from his pastoral duties as his health declined.
